text: Haven't been there for quite sometimes. Pleasantly surprised to see the entire garden been spruced up. Very nice. Instagram worthy.
A good spot to take photos, as there were interesting structures there. The best way to get there is via Nassim Gate.

It's like going on an adventure in ancient times and then coming back to the present. The garden has a layout of the evolution of the forest and plants in various forms, such as petrified wood, plants that are ancient and still exist today. This zone provided knowledge while instilling love for the world.
Somehow very immersive. Feels like you are walking through the land of dinosaurs. The information about the formation of the continents is also well presented and adds to the experience.

The pillars of petrified wood at the entrance of the Evolution Garden, known as the Trees of Stone. Evolution Garden presents a walk through time starting with primitive plants such as whisk ferns and horsetails before entering the world of lush ferns and flowering plants.
A show of the history and development of plants across the planet
